definition: rich peasant/social class of people farming their own land, intermediate between land-owner class 地主[di4 zhu3] and poor peasant 貧農|贫农[pin2 nong2]

sentences.english: Strictly prohibit landlords and rich peasants from sneaking into the peasant associations and poor peasant leagues.
sentences.chinese: 嚴禁地主富農分子混入農民協會和貧農團。

sentences.english: His master was a rich farmer in Brobdingnag , the land of the giants.
sentences.chinese: 他的主人是柏汀南巨人國的富農。

sentences.english: Build up a country adopting then hereafter, putting the policy preserving a rich peasant's into practice.
sentences.chinese: 建國以後，則採取實行保存富農的政策。

sentences.english: The third part is mainly rich peasants economic theory and policy.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分主要是富農經濟理論和政策。

sentences.english: What is his attitude to kulaks here?
sentences.chinese: 這裏他對富農的立場是什麼？

sentences.english: They feel that neither equal distribution nor distribution according to labour power is to their advantage.
sentences.chinese: 富農覺得平均分和按勞動力分兩種方法都於他們不利。

definition: (coll.) to tamper with/to mess around with
vegetable or food basket/(fig.) food supply
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
Anti-Rightist Movement, Mao's purge of "rightists" after the Hundred Flowers Campaign ended in 1957
